content: I am an Assistant Professor with the Department of CSE at IIT Hyderabad.
summary: I am an Assistant Professor with the Department of CSE at IIT Hyderabad.
title: Saurabh Joshi

summary: This paper is primarily about NP-completeness of $(k,i)$-coloring of graph and giving a parameterized algorithm for this problem using feedback vertex set as the parameter.
title: On the tractability of $(k,i)$-co(Extended Journal Version)

summary: This paper is primarily about NP-completeness of $(k,i)$-coloring of graph and giving a parameterized algorithm for this problem using feedback vertex set as the parameter.
title: On the tractability of $(k,i)$-coloring (Extended Journal Version)

summary: To celebrate the first 25 years of the International Conference on Principles and Practice of Constraint Programming (CP) the editors invited the authors of the most cited paper of each year to write a commentary on their paper. This report describes our reflections on the CP 2014 paper "Incremental Cardinality Constraints for MaxSAT" and its impact on the Maximum Satisfiability community and beyond.
title: Reflections on "Incremental Cardinality Constraints for MaxSAT"

summary: This paper presents a couple of incomplete Weighted MaxSAT solving techniques along with analysis on the deviation to the optimal value.
title: Open-WBO-Inc: Approximation Strategies for Incomplete Weighted MaxSAT

summary: This paper studies phase transition behaviour of CARD-XOR formulas.
title: Phase Transition Behavior of Cardinality and XOR Constraints

summary: This paper describes, Pinaka, a symbolic execution engine that leverages incremental SAT solving.
title: Pinaka: Symbolic Execution Meets Incremental Solving - (Competition Contribution)

summary: This paper presents a couple of incomplete Weighted MaxSAT solving techniques that allowed _Open-WBO-Inc_ to win accolades in MaxSAT evaluations 2018 and MaxSAT evaluations 2019.
title: Approximation Strategies for Incomplete MaxSAT

summary: This paper is primarily provides a parameterized algorithm for $(k,i)$-coloring  problem using feedback vertex set as the parameter.
title: On the tractability of $(k,i)$-coloring

summary: This paper shows NP-completeness of deadlock detection in certain class of MPI programs. It also presents encoding to analyze a class of MPI programs with respect to deadlocks.
title: Precise Predictive Analysis for Discovering Communication Deadlocks in MPI Programs

summary: This paper describes an efficient technique for equivalence checking of a real-world Floating Point Unit.
title: Equivalence Checking of a Floating-Point Unit Against a High-Level C Model

summary: This paper presents a different encoding that makes Bounded Model Checking faster for concurrent programs.
title: The virtues of conflict: analysing modern concurrency

summary: This paper is an extended version of the CP 2014 paper where incremental encoding is extended to weighted MaxSAT.
title: On Using Incremental Encodings in Unsatisfiability-based MaxSAT Solving

summary: This paper describes Generalized Totalizer Encoding (GTE) to encode Pseudo-Boolean Constraints. This encoding led Open-WBO to win accolades in MaxSAT evaluations and Pseudo-Boolean evaluations.
title: Generalized Totalizer Encoding for Pseudo-Boolean Constraints

summary: This paper describes a sound and complete tool, 2LS,  for program verification and the techniques behind its working.
title: Safety Verification and Refutation by $k$-Invariants and $k$-Induction

summary: This paper introduces Re-Order Bounded Model Checking to efficiently repair programs on weak memory models.
title: Property-Driven Fence Insertion Using Reorder Bounded Model Checking

summary: This paper describes techniques to incremental encode cardinality constraints. This led Open-WBO to win accolades in MaxSAT evaluations.
title: Incremental Cardinality Constraints for MaxSAT

summary: This paper presents a technique to perform May-Happen-in-Parallel analysis for languages with Dynamic Barriers.
title: A New Method of {MHP} Analysis for Languages with Dynamic Barriers

summary: This paper presents a technique to find interleaved bugs even with incomplete harness.
title: Underspecified harnesses and interleaved bugs

summary: This paper is primarily about NP-completeness of $(k,i)$-coloring of graph and giving a parameterized algorithm for this problem using feedback vertex set as the parameter.
title: Distributed Generalized Dynamic Barrier Synchronization
